title: Error when updating the shap package
body:
I had this piece of code for generating shap values for lightgbm, that was working. But it stopped working after I updated my shap package:
``` 
X_train_data = dtrain.data # load an input dataset X
X_train_data_sample = X_train_data.sample(frac= 0.01)
print('sample size of sampled oot data is ' + str(X_train_data_sample.shape))
explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model = lgb_model)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X_train_data_sample)

print(str(toc-tic) + " seconds to calculate SHAP values for oot data")
shap.summary_plot(shap_values, X_train_data_sample, plot_type="bar")
```

The error that I'm getting is here: 
```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
KeyError                                  Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-18-9f19e10e70a3> in <module>
     11 # Compute SHAP values and run a validation check that the sum of the SHAP values equals the output of the model
     12 tic =time.time()
---> 13 shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X_train_data_sample)
     14 
     15 toc = time.time()

~/.conda/envs/recent_trend_environment_update/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap/explainers/_tree.py in shap_values(self, X, y, tree_limit, approximate, check_additivity, from_call)
    288                 phi = self.model.original_model.predict(X, num_iteration=tree_limit, pred_contrib=True)
    289                 # Note: the data must be joined on the last axis
--> 290                 if self.model.original_model.params['objective'] == 'binary':
    291                     if not from_call:
    292                         warnings.warn('LightGBM binary classifier with TreeExplainer shap values output has changed to a list of ndarray')

KeyError: 'objective'
```

Any idea what has changed and how can I fix this?
